data.title: The Wedding of Frederick Barbarossa to Beatrice of Burgundy
data.text:
Object details

Object number

P25e4

Creator(s)

Giovanni Domenico Tiepolo (Venice, 1727 - 1804, Venice)

Title

The Wedding of Frederick Barbarossa to Beatrice of Burgundy

Date

about 1752

Medium

Oil on canvas

Provenance

Prince Nicolai Yousoupoff (1750-1831), St. Petersburg probably acquired when he was envoy to Turin, 1783-1789.

Prince Boris Yousoupoff, St. Petersburg.

Private collection, France.

Purchased by Isabella Stewart Gardner from an English collection through the art dealers Wildenstein & Co., Paris for 6,000 francs on 2 April 1900, through the American painter and collector Ralph W. Curtis (1854-1922) and Fernand Robert, her regular agent in Paris.

Signatures, inscriptions, and markings

Inscribed in paint (stretcher, top): 3157

Inscribed (stretcher, center): P199

Stamped (stretcher, base, right): Milay (?) Paris

Dimensions

71 x 54 cm (27 15/16 x 21 1/4 in.)

Commentary

Isabella Stewart Gardner kept meticulous records of many of her acquisitions. In keeping with this legacy, object information is continually being reviewed, updated, and enriched in order to give greater access to the collection.

Gallery

Veronese Room

Bibliography

P. Molmenti. G. B. Tiepolo: la sua vita e le sue opere (Milan, 1909), p. 284. (as Giovanni Battista Tiepolo)

Max H. von Freeden and Carl Lamb. Das Meisterwerk des Giovanni Battista Tiepolo: Die Fresken der Wüzburger Residenz (Munich, 1956), pl. 30.

George L. Stout. Treasures from the Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum (Boston, 1969), pp. 176-77, ill. (as Giovanni Battista Tiepolo)

Philip Hendy. European and American Paintings in the Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum (Boston, 1974), pp. 249-50. (as Giovanni Battista Tiepolo)

Rollin van N. Hadley. Museums Discovered: The Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum (Boston, 1981), pp. 94-5. (as Giovanni Battista Tiepolo)

Michael Levey. Giambattista Tiepolo: His Life and Art (New Haven, 1986), pp. 185-86, pl. 166. (as follower of Giovanni Battista Tiepolo)

Massimo Gemin and Filippo Pedrocco. Giambattista Tiepolo: I dipinti. Opera completa (Venice, 1993), p. 423, cat. 413a. (as Giovanni Battista Tiepolo)

Peter O. Krückmann. Tiepolo: Heaven on Earth, Masterpieces of the Würzburg Years (Munich, 1996), pp. 85-87, fig. 75. (as Giandomenico Tiepolo)

Peter O. Krückmann. Der Himmel auf Erden Tiepolo in Würzburg 1. Exh. cat. (Munich, 1996), p. 77, cat. 5. (as Giovanni Battista Tiepolo)

Hilliard Goldfarb et al. Italian Paintings and Drawings Before 1800 in the Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum. Unpublished manuscript. (Boston, 1996-2000). (as Giovanni Domenico Tiepolo)

Hilliard Goldfarb. "Oil Sketches in the Practice of Tiepolo and his Studio at Würzburg" in Achim Gnann et al. Festschrift für Konrad Oberhuber (Milan, 2000), pp. 207-14, fig. 1. (as Giovanni Domenico Tiepolo)
